solution_line_template: Therefore, after 1 year his portfolio has grown to ${initial_portfolio_amount} + ${gain_year1} = $<<{initial_portfolio_amount}+{gain_year1}={portfolio_after_year1}>>{portfolio_after_year1}

He then adds ${added_amount} to this total, so his new portfolio total is ${portfolio_after_year1} + ${added_amount} = $<<{portfolio_after_year1}+{added_amount}={portfolio_before_year2_growth}>>{portfolio_before_year2_growth} at the beginning of year 2

Next, this total grows by {growth_rate_year2_percent}%, so he gains ${portfolio_before_year2_growth} * {growth_rate_year2_decimal} = $<<{portfolio_before_year2_growth}*{growth_rate_year2_decimal}={gain_year2}>>{gain_year2} across year 2
Thus, after year 2, his portfolio is worth ${portfolio_before_year2_growth} + ${gain_year2} = $<<{portfolio_before_year2_growth}+{gain_year2}={final_portfolio_worth}>>{final_portfolio_worth}
